meanings.sent1: Her valiance in facing her fears inspired others to be brave.
meanings.sent2: The knight's valiance in battle earned him the respect of his peers.
meanings.sent3: Despite her small size, the kitten showed valiance in standing up to the big dog.
meanings.sent4: The firefighter's valiance was like a shining beacon of hope in the midst of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The valiance of the soldier was etched in the memories of all who witnessed his heroic act.

meanings.definition: The quality of being valiant or courageous
meanings.sent1: The valiance of the team was evident in their unwavering determination to succeed.
meanings.sent2: His valiance shone through in the face of adversity, never backing down from a challenge.
meanings.sent3: The valiance of the squirrel trying to steal food from the bird feeder was both amusing and impressive.
meanings.sent4: The valiance of the sun breaking through the storm clouds was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The valiance of the flower pushing through the cracks in the pavement symbolized resilience and strength.
